TopicTitle: Jool in My Night Sky - New Music after landing on Laythe

Articles.Content:
Jool lives up to its name. Beautiful when viewed from Laythe. Here is music to commemorate the successful landing.

https://soundcloud.com/billy-winn-2/jool-in-my-night-sky

Great pics and soundtrack, i managed to get a probe into an egg-shaped orbit around Jool once but that's as far as i got hehe, you make the music yourself? it's really good.

Edit* Just going through your other tunes, they're really good, do you think if i bought music creator on Steam i could make music like you or are you using really expensive tools?

Edited June 16, 2013 by Custard Donut (In Space)

Hey Custard, thanks, I make the music myself. The main tool I use is FL Studio. It available on Amazon (Fruity Ed) for around $100, although I use the Producer Ed. which is quite a bit more costly (I think it was 400 on Amazon.) Then there are addons and additional sounds that I like to use. They are each separate costs such as Philharmonic Orchestra have higher costs.

Music is more expressions of the heart and soul. Feel the music and it will come to life for you. I stand by FL Studio. It is an absolutely great tool. If I can help you learn it, let me know. I am always willing to help fellow artists.
Very nice music. Cosmic, upbeat but not intrusive. Thumbs up.
Thanks man that's very kind, still going through your tunes, they really are good.
